column1: Bektemir Rozmatjon Ogli Meliqoziyev (born 13 April 1996) is an Uzbek professional boxer. As an amateur
column2: he won a silver medal at the 2016 Summer Olympics as a middleweight.

column1: Round of 32: Defeated Zaal Kvachatadze (Georgia) KO
Semi-finals: Defeated Michael O'Reilly (Republic of Ireland) 2–1
Semi-final: Defeated by Joe Ward (Republic of Ireland) 3–2

column2: Melikuziev made his professional debut against the experienced Argentinian Martin Fidel Rios. Melikuziev won the bout after knocking Rios out with a left hand to the body in the opening round. Melikuziev's second bout as a professional was against Ricardo Adrian Luna Flores on 30 August 2019. Melikuziev secured a first round win after dropping his Mexican opponent on the canvas twice following a series of strong body shots
column3: Melikuziev was declared the winner after Luna Flores was unable to recover from a second time on the canvas.On 2 November 2019
column4: Melikuziev fought professionally for a third time on the undercard of Canelo Álvarez vs Sergey Kovalev against Clay Collard. Melikuziev won via fourth round technical knockout after slowly wearing his opponent down with a number of heavy body shots. Melikuziev was taken the distance for the first time as a professional when he fought Vaughn Alexander on 13 December 2019. Melikuziev won via wide unanimous decision after winning every round on each of the three scorecards.On 14 February 2020
column5: Melikuziev fought against Oscar Cortes. In the opening round
column6: Melikuziev put his opponent on the canvas with a right hand to the head. Cortes landed  few shots throughout the bout and Melikuziev eventually dropped his opponent for a second time in the round with a heavy shot to the body
column8: referee Edward Hernandez Sr called an end to the fight.
